intro: Jumellea cowanii, commonly known as the Cowan's jumellea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions. Jumellea cowanii is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
